Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: SDorset
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Savoy for a long weekend mid April. Unfortunately it rained for the entire duration but the hotel made up for the dreadful weather. The staff were so helpful and friendly and couldn't do enough to make our visit a pleasurable one. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the room we were upgraded to was spacious and comfortable. However, there wasn't any facilities to make tea or coffee and there wasn't an iron, but the reception staff immediately sent the friendly porter up with a full sized ironing board and iron on request. The location was very central with only a short walk to The Spanish Steps and the Trivi fountain. If you're expecting to experience good Italian food, then think again. We found it an impossible task to find anywhere with even mediocre food, it was incredibly bland and extortionately expensive. The buffet breakfast at the hotel was extensive and catered for all tastes. I would definitely recommend the Savoy. Thank you to all the staff that made our stay so enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - would stay again no bother.”
Reviews.Author: Holidaymaker186543
Reviews.Content: Just enjoyed a 4 night stay in the wonderful Hotel Savoy in Rome. Staff very friendly and helpful. They sorted out a problem for us where our trip agent forgot to pick us up. Reception staff sorted this out for us no bother at all. Hotel spotless clean, breakfast very good, something for everyone, location could not be better.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised - would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: scm1133
Reviews.Content: I was reluctant to stay at this hotel based on the trip advisor reviews and the lack of consistency in the service. However, we opted to stay because we'd had a friend stay in the past who enjoyed the hotel. Pros: Great location. We were able to walk everywhere and felt safe walking back at night. That said, it is up a very steep hill and it was a challenge for my mother - just a heads up for older guests! The room was fine, the bathroom large, and the breakfast sufficient with a nice selection of hot food, cold food, and teas/coffee. We didn't spend much time in our room, other than to sleep, so it really was fine. The front desk staff was helpful - not above and beyond - but answered questions and made reservations. Got the job done! Cons: I do not think that all rooms in this hotel are created equal - for example, we had a lot of space, but we could hear the elevator all night - every night - and it made it a bit hard to sleep at times. That said, smaller rooms down the hall were quieter, but probably didn't have as much space and weren't as comfortable. Hope this helps future visitors!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: mary g
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel Nov 6-10,2011 and was completely satisfied with everything. The best coffee I have ever tasted at breakfast and the food was not bad either! Front desk employees always helpful especially Emiliano - he was the BEST! I would stay here again - if I am lucky enough to travel to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL ROME”
Reviews.Author: gemFC
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that Rome is on of the best places that I have been to so I was just happy to be there ! The hotel was really good the location is excellent and easy to reach where you want to go. The hotel was quite easy to find but a tip is when you arrive in the underground station dont come stright up its easier to walk along the walk one underground ypu will then pop up at the end of the road where the hotel is rather than struggle up the spainish steps !. The rooms were basic and a bit dated but nice and clean the roof top bar gave you a fantastic view of the city and is especialy nice in the evening. the staff were really helpful and even sorted out some maps to help us around which was lovely of them. The breakfast was good and there was enough to choose from to get your day started. All in all this is a really good city hotel in a really good location at a good price. I would choose this one again.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Lisa W
Reviews.Content: room good, breakfast really good, hotel clean, perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing. Great location for site seeing.”
Reviews.Author: JAB39
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from 16-23 Sept 2011. It was our first visit to Rome. Location very good and easy to get around Rome. It was our Silver Wedding on the 19 Sept and we were so looking forward to our stay. How disappointed we were in our room. Small and very dark. It faced the front of the hotel on the 1st floor but was on the corner with no view. We were led to believe that the room would be much larger. The room safe did not work. When I mentioned all this to the hotel reception, regarding the size, all I got was a shrug of the shoulders and told that was what was allocated and nothing could be done. I was told the room safe would be attended to that day. There were plenty people around asking questions, checking in etc,so maybe the gentleman was having a bad day.Needless to say when we left a week later the safe had not been repaired. Considering this is part of what we paid for it could be argued that the hotel did not fulfil its obligation. No mention was made of our anniversary, in spite of email&cards delivered to our room, which I would have expected as part of customer service. I would have thought a 4 star hotel would have been more friendly but then again maybe the idea was to be efficient rather than friendly but it wasn't even that. What a difference when we moved on to Florence to the Alba. Smiling, friendly staff, welcoming and so helpful. A bottle of wine and local sweets, with an anniversay congratulations note, in our room on arrival. We'll go back there but not to the Savoy in Rome. The hotel looked good from the outside and had an amazing reception. A great pity our stay did not live up to this.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in Rome's Smartest Location”
Reviews.Author: ATOJACK
Reviews.Content: Savoy is a synonym for excessive glitz and glamour, however the Rome's Savoy is rather quiet and understated. The reception area could be less business-like and more opulent- Lobby needs to be flung open and look inviting with a touch of the Savoy opulence. The staff were very friendly and professional. Located in the smartest part of Rome, it has a stunning view of the city from the roof top cafe- very Italian. The rooms could be slightly bigger but the bathrooms were good. Excellent value for money and I have no complaints about the hotel and would certainly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable, but did not offer much in the way of a view. Other than no view, this hotel was terrific. The location was on a quiet street in the NE portion of the tourist area. Tour buses picked up and let off right in front of the hotel. Staff was very helpful in helping us map out activities. The breakfast that is included is pretty good, but you are forced to eat in a windowless dungeon in the basement. Meanwhile, a beautiful roof-top restaurant sits empty until they open at 4pm. The roof-top bar provides the only thing in the way of a view. It was a great place to have a drink at night. Staying at Hotel Savoy was very nice, but if I went back I would probably be interested to see what a different hotel had to offer. But if you're heading to Rome for the first time, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: JuanBe1965
Reviews.Content: Twelve days ago, I was stay in Rome. It´s my first time in this city. I was spend three fantastic days because one friend was recommend me this hotel. The location is fantastic, it´s very close to everything. Besides, if you like the traditional architecture of Roma, this hotel, it´s the best place to stay because the furniture, the rooms, the lobby, the bar and restaurants, it´s really amazing. But, the first thing because I will return it´s the fantastic attention of the people are working in the hotel. The people it´s very friendly and very profesional. I am mexican, i know about that. The relation of the price vs room it´s excellent. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: SuzySue58
Reviews.Content: We stay in this hotel every year and it is amazing. From the moment we arrive, the staff cannot do enough to help you and ensure your stay in Rome is perfect. Our room was very modern with an Italian twist. The staff are so friendly and genuinely want you to have a good time, nothing is too much trouble. A lovely selection for breakfast which sets you up for the day. In a superb location, being not only within walking distance of great shops and landmarks such as Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain but also a nearby Metro station should you wish to travel further afield independently. Would recommend having a cappucino or glass of wine on the roof terrace!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: australia2italy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and couldn't have been happier. Our room, the restaurant, the staff, the breakfast, all fantastic. Our favourite hotel in Italy that we stayed in. The staff couldn't do enough to help us, and wanted us to be comfortable in the hotel. The breakfast was massive - a huge variety (how could anyone be unhappy with the breakfast?) The only negative was that the internet was expensive, but who cares? Everything else was perfect. Would definitely stay here next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Four Star Hotel - Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Bengeary
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights. When we got to our room we were met by the unbearable smell from the bathroom. We spoke to the gentleman on the desk, explained about the bathroom and the fact that the safe was not open etc. He explained that it would be the next day before the safe could be accessed. Naturally we were not happy with this and persisted until we were changed to a different room. The new room was much smaller than the original and another bed had to be set up to accomodate us. As we had been delayed by the room change our itinerary on the first day was completely thrown and we asked for a refund. They pointed out that we had been "accomodated" and it was only when we persisted that they agreed to a meeting with the Manager. The room in general was quite tired and in need of a facelift but on the plus side there was no odour from the bathroom. There were no tea or coffee facilities available in the room so as we were now late we decided to go ahead and have lunch in the hotel. We were greeted by a most helpful young lady who offered us a "welcome drink". We ordered lunch which was flavourless and cost close to €100 (no drinks) for three, crazy money! The coffee is straight out of a machine and it does not get any better for breakfast... All the Manager was willing to do to compensate us was to offer sparkling wine on one evening and tour bus tickets for one day. We were given no other alternative but to accept this. As it happens when we tried to use our bus tickets we were told that they were the wrong ones... Breakfast was served in the basement, it is buffet style and not at all appealing. All in all a complete let down from rooms to service - we were most disappointed. Think twice before parting with your money to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Great”
Reviews.Author: HappySnaps
Reviews.Content: A friend and I just stayed here on 15 Oct for one night as part of post-cruise package arranged through Cunard. I'm not sure what the cost was for the night's stay but it wasn't a cheap package so either the hotel or Cunard is making a nice profit on an otherwise unremarkable and average hotel room. The hotel must have deals with several tour companies as the hotel guests seemed to be comprised of large tour groups. With the name "Savoy" and a location near the Via Veneto, we expected a much nicer hotel than this. The hotel is conveniently located for walking to Borghese Park, Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Our room was on the small side, older decor with dark carpeting and gold wallpaper. It was very stuffy in the room and the A/C didn't work. When we inquired at the front desk, they explained that the A/C was turned off for the whole hotel, as it was October (never mind that it was a warm day). They recommended opening the window but our room faced out onto a courtyard roof that would have given access into our room from the outside so that was not a good option. They did offer us another room higher up that was even shabbier than the one we had, so we kept our original room. I would say that if you got a good price for a room here, it would be an OK place to stay but don't expect anything upscale. There is an OK breakfast buffet but I wouldn't pay extra for it.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: annlKildare
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days at the end of a Med Cruise. Our Room wasnt ready on arrival but arriving at 10.00 am was a bit impertinant. . We were invited to have coffee and relax in the roof restaurant till our room was ready which did not take long. The location of this hotel is so so good .The Borghese gardens are a stroll away as is the metro which gives easy access to the Vatican or the Colleseum. If you arrive in St Peters and the line of visitors is half way around the square do not be disheartened it moves fast enough. THe proximity of a variety of restaurants is amazing. The hotel gave us a complimentary dinner on one evening. It was very good , the food was superb. Views from the restaurant are very good. The room was large with plenty of space . There was also a minibar. The bathroom also was more than adequate. The staff were very friendly and the room was kept immaculate. We will return to stay here aagain

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in pricey shopping area”
Reviews.Author: letmego_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel is lovely, beds comfortable, if you remove the extremely heavy comforter (has to weigh 30 lbs.- feels like the lead filled shield that they cover you with when getting an xray done!). The bathrooms are beautifully tiled with a deep but narrow long bathtub including a shower. Toilet and bidet in the bathroom. We had a street view standard room which was clean. Breakfast buffet was included in our package and had good options available. Hotel is located in a pricey shopping district (ie: Versace just up the street) which means that resaurants on the main streets are VERY EXPENSIVE. *TIP: Get off the main roads and explore some side streets...resaurants are half the price, food is excellent. Pastry shops also sell great hot food at a more reasonable price. Main termini station is located a few blocks away but the best option is hop-on, hop-off open top double decker buses for getting around the city to the best attractions. We bought the 48 hour bus pass for 28.00 EURO per person and it was a fantastic way to get to the sights. The buses provide headphones (you keep) on your first trip on the bus and they provide an audio guide as you ride through the city. You can purchase the bus pass at hotel reception. Buses run approximately every half hour. All in all, a good hotel but area expensive for meals. ALSO NOTE: When we went to check out, someone had eaten at the hotel rooftop restaurant and charged their 180.00 EURO meal to our room. We had not even seen the rooftop restaurant and had to sign the bill stating that they were not our charges. Initials signed on the bottom of the restaurant bill did not match our initials. They definitely need a better system to check that charges posted to rooms are indeed the rooms that the customers are staying in!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, generic rooms”
Reviews.Author: RoxburyNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Savoy at the beginning of Sept before our cruise. Our room was your basic standard average room - think Clarion hotel. It was clean, although there were stains on the comforter. Overall, it's good for a one night stay. Skip the breakfast room if it's not included in your rate and hit one of the local cafe's for coffee. No coffee maker in the room is a drawback. The staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars to The Manager”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneGubby
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed at this hotel but I have sent many customers here who have reported to me their satisfaction with this hotel. In Rome there are problems with air con , noise, small rooms etc ..even in 5 star hotel. Remember you are in an ancient city. 5 stars to the manager who cares enough about the hotel's reputation to take the time to respond on trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Jay W
Reviews.Content: At 2AM there was a banging on our hotel room door, sounded like a pole or a bat, we called reception to assist up because we were scared out of our wits but they refuse to come up and help. would never go back there even if they paid us to. What normal person would not come to assist another person in trouble and asking for help. we packed up and got out of there quick smart

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel for a Honeymoon Stay!”
Reviews.Author: blacklion1
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful stay at the Savoy Hotel in Rome, Italy. My wife and I had just been married two days before in New York. The Savoy is located on via Ludovisi, just off the via Veneto. The location is convenient to most sights such as the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. There is a metro stop within walking distance. There is also a supermarket within three blocks of the hotel. I mention this because traveling in Rome is expensive. I also recommend purchasing a Roma Pass which is valid for three days and provides for unlimited transportation on Rome's extensive bus and train system. The hotel staff was always helpful and informative. The room was comfortable and very clean. Beware the in room refrigerator. Remember the supermarket three blocks away. We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant just about everyday. It's buffet style and provides for everyone's taste. Add the breakfast to your hotel stay. We had dinner one time on the hotels rooftop restaurant. Again the service staff was attentive and the food was great. The rooftop restaurant is open air and offers spectacular views of Rome. We would definitely stay again at the Savoy.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with easy access to all sights”
Reviews.Author: PlymouthAngela
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel and great view from the roof terrace where you could enjoy a lovely relaxing drink after your busy day viewing all the sights.Had a very good breakfast bar with all you could want to start your day.And the bus stops were not far from the entrance.And great shopping around the corner.The rooms i found were a little dark.Otherwise ok.All had a great time.We went in APRIL 2010.If you want to see Rome you will be ok here.

Reviews.Title: “passport picture and credit card”
Reviews.Author: dhound
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff took my passport copy and directed me to the only atm outside of their lobby in which to use my credit card to get Euro's (went back to the hotel sick from work had the Flu). That night my id and card number was used with forged signatures at the Paris Piano Bar, which advertises itself as advertising and IT services to the card companies. Clearly a scam. The bar even gave whoever a nice 210 Euro tip, charged 700 euros on my card for a bottle of champagne (1000 us dollars), 120 dollars for fruit, 200 for some misc item, and 15 states consumption (what else did they consume, I don't know). Someone on the staff is a theif.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Savoy...Amazing hotel wonderful staff!!”
Reviews.Author: MMK96
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently had the pleasure of enjoying a 5 night stay in the extremely elegant, ambient and fantastically located Hotel Savoy on Via Ludovisi, Roma. My sister was getting married in Rome (San Silvestro) and she choose the hotel for her and her husband and also for extended family members travelling over for the wedding. My Husband, my 6 six year old son an my 3 year old son were given a family room. I must admit I was a little apprehensive before checking in as some of the reviews on this site rate the Hotel badly, however I am delighted to reprot that these reveiws are completely unfounded. Our room was extremely comfortable, fully air conditioned, luxurious bathroom with plenty of towels, etc and it was impecably cleaned each day. Now,onto the breakfast which was a real treat each morning..Hotel Savoy has a fantastic selection plenty of cereals (coco pops which my kids were thrilled with!!), huge selection of scones and bread rolls, jams, toast, bacon, eggs, croissants, danish, coffe, latte, cappaucino, espresso, breakfast tea, earl grey you name it they had!! The staff in the hotel were extremely helpful and so warm and welcoming to my sister and her new husband upon arrival as they knew they were in Rome to get married. The hotel has an amazing rooftop bar & restaurant which we drank in every night the staff were so attentive and prompt and also they give delicious little snacks with the drinks. I have to give special mention to restaurant manager Aldo, he literally could not have been more helpful and went to great lenghts to ensure the wedding day meal was a deliciously spectacular affair. The food in the restaurant is out of this world especially the little warm chocolate fondant type dessert...magic!!! Also the views from the rooftop are breathtaking it is so well located and feels very safe even late at night as a mother of two i thoroughly recomend Hotel Savoy, Rome for families. We had a lovely time in Rome,each day was filled with life long happy memories and it was lovely to return to such a relaxing and luxurious hotel each evening to unwind and of course a few cosmopoloitans on the rooftop bar!! Hotel Savoy is on the pricier side of life, but for a special occasion like a weddin or romantic trip it's well worth it and thte staff all had very good english and were very good giving us directions for day trips, taxis, etc. I would be more than happy to return to Savoy Hotel again....in fact i'd go again in the morning if i got a chance!! Thank-you Hotel Savoy!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings!”
Reviews.Author: Jet34
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, there was confusion regarding our booking. The hotel outside I felt didn't represent the interior. It gave the impression of something much grander. The rooftop terrace gives fabulous views over Rome - not to be missed. The majority of the staff were helpful and friendly. The room was large, but rather old fashioned or perhaps a 'traditional' feel. The hotel is in a good central location.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there for location”
Reviews.Author: VegasGirl27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Savoy because of its location. Walking distance to everything... Breakfast for what you pay was good..fulling..It was a little stuffy in the breakfast area maybe because it was in the basement. As for the rooms..they were small and beds need to be replaced and bathroom was small also...I am a petite woman and had problems in the tub because of the way the plumbing was attached to the wall.We had to complain to the front desk a few times because they were in the ceiling fixing either the Ac or electrical stuff at 700 am and one of the workers were smoking up there and it was coming thru the vent..The front desk listened and fixed the situation..all was well. Staff was friendly and we found it pretty clean..There was no view from our window but like I said in the beginning we were there for its location..Would we stay there again? Probably..

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't wait to get out of this hotel and never again will we stay there! This is a 2 Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: savvygirlLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I regret that I have not listen to one Tripadvisor terrible review "don't be deceived by the lobby photos". Well, normally I would book a room in advance but I waited till about 2 weeks before, because I was not sure of my plans in Rome. Most hotels for triple rooms were sold out. I figured Savoy was near Spanish Steps and my car rental so I took a chance and I booked the hotel for 3 nights (2 nights too many) at $330 per night. The booking process was simple and quite good. The hotel was located just off the Via Veneto and lobby looked nice. We were informed that we were getting 1/2 an hour complimentary internet and breakfast. We went to our room and our excitement ball dropped. The room was dark, depressing, narrow window facing the outside of the other wall and of course to keep the spirit up I said "at least we will get a good night sleep, since we have no street noise." I was wrong again. Our a/c started to make strange clicking sounds, we called the front desk and bell man came to tell us that this noise is a normal thing. The beds were very uncomfortable, the blanket reminded me of military brown blankets one uses while camping out, very harsh, irritating my skin, and looking old, also the comforters looked dingy. The pillow was about 5 kg - heavy, felt like someone stuffed them with pieces of fabric, dark navy blue carpets. This room looked dirty and the only thing that made us happy was to leave the room. Even the safe was inside the refrigerator which someone could pick up and walk out with it. The walls were thin, at 2 am we were awaken by some guys running trough the hallways screaming. By then we were up and heard every conversation people had outside the hallway. Breakfast was in the basement and it was nothing special. Again, did not feel clean, the room had no natural light. Going from one depressing room to another. We grabbed a roll and never went back to breakfast again in 3 night stay. On our second day my husband went to get his 1/2 free internet and the front desk said that "our room did not come with this perk" and he called the girl who checked us in and she said that she never offered us the 1/2 hour. So I went down stairs and caused some commotion, ready to check out that minute, the receptionist gave me 24 hours free. I do not understand their mentality, really. The next day (Sunday) we asked the front desk which seemed to be concierge also where to go for a good lunch not touristy near this hotel. Same girl who checked us in with the 1/2 internet offer sent us to Pomodoro Pizzeria. Well, this restaurant was closed on Sundays, we found this out from the Marriott Hotel concierge across the street who recommended another pizzeria ( we were seeking a room, but they were fully booked) . Two hours later we told her that she send us to a closed restaurant and we asked for a nearest Supermarket, she send us again to an underground Supermarket which was closed also. This was very frustrating. Don't you think the hotel stuff should know the hours of operation. Also, every time I was at the front desk there was a hotel guest complaining about something or having issues. We were so miserable at this hotel that when we left and said to my family "oh shoot, I forgot to take the picture of the room to post on the Tripadvisor" my 8 year said "Mom, why would you want to take a photo of that terrible place, it is best not to remember." I guess she was right. Grand Hotel Continental in Siena cured our wounds. I would not go back to Savoy ever again, the lobby is deceiving and the location is not important when you get nothing for your bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star standard”
Reviews.Author: juliagould
Reviews.Content: We were very dissapointed with "The Savoy", rooms were tiny, (not like the pictures) and breakfast was awful, and downstairs with no windows it felt like you were in a crypt, definately not 4 star at all.However it is extremely well situated and the roof top terrace is lovely, if you upgraded to a decent size room and didn't do breakfast it is o.k.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Franart
Reviews.Content: After 10 days in Italy at some really nice hotels, I was disappointed with the Savoy. The rooms were an adequate size as was the bathroom, but the hotel staff always seemed like they were doing you a favor when answering a question. The restaurant is EXPENSIVE and the breakfast buffet is served in the basement of the hotel (though nicely decorated). The roof top garden was a welcoming edition but the bar service was scarce. No FREE wi-fi anywhere - not even in the lobby. When I asked the front desk to help with printing my boarding pass, they pointed me to the 'pay as you go' computer in the lobby. No help whatsoever. I would NOT stay at this hotel again. Not a good value for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “I won't come here even for free !”
Reviews.Author: greekcypriot2009
Reviews.Content: Besides the good location, I find nothing good with this hotel. We were disappointed starting with the reception staff people. They were not professionals at all and although they tried to be helpful, they were giving us always wrong directions. The restaurant was fine but in a dark room with no windows around, and we went there just for breakfast. It was a buffet ok, but not what we really expected to find out of a Savoy hotel! The room was extremely small but I don’t know for what reason it was impossible for me to sleep. It was the first time I felt as if there was a negative energy in the room and I was scared to be honest each time I got in our room. No, I would not return to this hotel again even if I was given a free stay. I booked here because I loved the Savoy in Berlin. The one in Rome is so different. If it wasn’t for the excellent location, it would have been a complete disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back”
Reviews.Author: Silawat_Tao_Bkk
Reviews.Content: The room is quite old. Feel not good to sleep. The shower is not comfortable. Hot, warm, cold water at the same bath time. The front desk service is very cold. No free WIFI even in the lobby. Breakfast is good but the place is in underground. The hotel look like old hospital as my feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: DunstableTraveller
Reviews.Content: Went for a city break - hotel was perfect for this - walking distance for the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain - tour bus picked up and dropped off down the road (although some of the other companies did seem to have a more regular service!). Breakfast was excellent and food in the Restaurant was good (if a bit expensive - but so was the rest of Rome!!). Room clean and very well appointed with good size bathroom etc. Only reservation - if you are planning to use the restaurant check that there is not a private party on, which means the roof terrace is out of bounds (our main reason for having a meal at the hotel) as after a full day's site seeing we were too tired to look anywhere else so had to eat inside!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jeremiah29111
Reviews.Content: Sounds like the reviews depend on the room you get at this hotel since they vary so much. I went not expecting much for the money but knew it was a good location and was pleasantly surprised at the service at the front desk and room acceptable. I booked the superior room/comes with breakfast. Brkfst ok coffee good, maybe it's Euopean way but the runny eggs and nearly raw bacon not appetizing, so stayed away from that. Room 520 had what they call a double bed, yes bed is firm, bathroom good with marble walls floors A/C in this room was good but could not adjust it, glad I like it cold. Hop on off bus great, close by .Roof top good view. Good Restaurant R out hotel 2blks down, go R to sidewalk cafe, great pasta, better than the very expensive Veneto cafe.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hospitality experience.....ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Pluma24
Reviews.Content: After 45 years serving retail customers I retired and my wife and I planned our dream vacation. The Savoy Hotel in Rome was our first stop. From the time we arrived; there was no one to help us get our bags from the street; the surly desk clerk told us we would have a queen bed......we had two twin beds with "sandpaper" quality sheets, no more than 200 thread count, shoved together and made up separated; the only way to get a cup of coffee was to buy the 15 euro breakfast, otherwise I had to walk to a bar a block away (I am not making this up!); called to see if they had an iron we could use and you would thought I had ask them to kill themselves....certainly not, but they had a service we could use (I could have bought a new set of clothes for the price); the room was postage stamp size; the towels were the thickness of a cup towel; but the main problem was the attitude of the staff........you would have thought I was interrupting some sort of global strategy conference when I asked a question at the front desk......beyond rude, total contempt on the part of the staff.....never seen anything like it in all my years and world travels. No way this is a 4 star, for that matter a 2 star.....NO WAY!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Clean and well maintained.”
Reviews.Author: Hotelsavoy1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money and the location is perfect. Located in an upmarket area of Rome with restaurants and shops within 100 meters. Also 10 minute walk from spanish steps and 15 minute walk from Trevi fountain. In fact all major attractions are walkable. Bus stops and taxi rank also witnin 100 meters. The Sun Terrace on the 6th floor provides panoramic views over the city where you can relax with a drink and have dinner. Breakfast is good quality (especially the coffee) only down side is that breakfast is not served on the roof terrace but in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but rooms need a facelift”
Reviews.Author: chrnic25
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a nice, convenient area within walking distance of many sites(Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain) and the Metro. The hotel staff was very friendly and extremely helpful with all our tourist questions. The room was comfortable and the bathroom was quite large especially by European standards and it looked to have been renovated within the last couple of years. My main complaint was that the bed was hard as a rock and the carpets, linens and furniture were very dated and worn which gave the room an overall shabby feel. I would consider staying here again but would also loook at other options.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't great for the money”
Reviews.Author: sck68
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a pretty good location and an easy walk to many Rome attractions. The hotel reception staffs are inviting and very pleasant. The hotel roof terrace is good for a drink, with views across the rooftops of the local area and the tops of some of the main buildings in the not so far distance. Our room was quiet from the traffic outside, but not quiet from the noise in the hallway. The doors aren’t thick enough to keep the opening and closing of nearby room doors and talking out of our room. Also you can hear showers and hair dryers from neighbouring rooms. The hotel rooms are old and tired. The furniture is in desperate need of being changed, especially the beds, which are rock solid. There are marks all over the desk and bedside tables. The bathroom is old and in the main average décor expected for this type of hotel. There was also no shower gel provided in the bathrooms, despite providing everything else. The breakfast was average, providing a spread of warm and cold foods. We were amazed to find that the Internet was not free and that the charges are prohibitive! There is not even free wi-fi in the reception and other common areas. Overall it was nothing special. Expensive for what it is and would not recommend staying here. This hotel is at best a 3 star hotel, I have no idea how they achieved their 4 star status.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Lisa71416
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Savoy Hotel in Rome. It is a lovely hotel, could not fault the rooms, TV, mini bar, safe, spotless bathroom with hairdryer; staff are very friendly and helpful as on our return the transfer we had booked was over an hour late, the receptionist could see we had been waiting and asked if we needed any help in chasing the company or organising a taxi. The location is ideal and the hop on/off sightseeing buses stop just at the corner of the street so ideal. The street is a busy street but shutters and double glazing shut out all the noise at night so it isn't a problem and the room has air conditioning not that we needed it in April. The breakfast offers cereal, fruit, cakes, pastries and choices of bread along with scrambled/hard boiled eggs, bacon and sausage - this is the same everyday, just what you need to start off the busy day sightseeing. I would definately stay there again and would not hesitate in recommending to friends and family. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance, it is not far from Borghese Park and Barberini. One bonus would have been tea/coffee facilities in the room, but that is just me being picky.

Reviews.Title: “Seems old, but in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Juzba
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night there and it was ok, but still a bit too expensive for what it offers. The hotel has no garage, so you have to park the car in nerby Westin Excelsior hotel and it costs 35€ per day, which is a lot. Breakfast was ok, but it was in some underground room, which I didn't find very amusing, especially since the hotel has a very beautiful terrace, which is definately the highlight of the hotel. The staff was polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor condition of room”
Reviews.Author: B_JLichfield
Reviews.Content: Nice reception area, great roof top resteraunt good service and food. Poor hotel room, 1st floor rooms noisy due to the A/C units outside and very tired furniture, fittings and room overall. Expected better for the price and the name associated with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: italiangirl080352
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Savoy for six nights in late March 2011. The room was very large, clean and very quiet. The food quality at breakfast was very good and the staff was pleasant and helpful. We would stay at the Savoy again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: HeatherB03
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of April and really enjoyed our stay. It is really handy for the Borghese Park and the Spanish steps and there are bus stops just down the road for tour and local buses. The breakfasts were excellent, with plenty of choice and fresh coffee. Although a fairly quiet area, there are some places to eat in the evening, including Hard Rock cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, friendly staff, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: VTI
Reviews.Content: With my wife we did book this hotel for its good location and clean rooms. When we reached at the hotel we are satisfied with the results. At first our room was on the 5th floor, with the bellboy, we checked the room and saw that the room is nothing like the pictures of the hotel's website, for instance; there was curtain on the shower, but on the pictures not. So we get to reception and demanded to change the room for lower floors; the staff was helpful and they changed our room without further conversation. The std room that we stayed on the first floor is better then the other. Let me remind you that this is an old hotel that needs renovation and with small rooms, but this is Italy and Rome every hotel is like that! Next morning the breakfast was 7 out of 10 for us, since as Turkish couple we seek olives, tomato etc, in it. The coffee was good and you have a variety of options for a light breakfast. The room is cleaned every day, and amenities are freshened. In conclusion, I give 7 out of 10 for the Savoy just because I think that money paid in Rome for the hotels does not match the quality standard that you got in return. This is not a special comment for Savoy but for all 4 stars in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “No Free WiFi”
Reviews.Author: Fudsdad
Reviews.Content: For a classy hotel like this I was amazed that there was no complimentary WiFi provided. After all there are WiFi hotspots on street corners elsewhere in Rome. Instead you had to pay through the nose for a Swiss Com outfit to provide it at senveral euros for ten minutes. Rip off!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Craigtown
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on a recent trip to Rome and were very satisfied with our stay. Got a rate of £95/ night on Travel republic to include breakfast. I think it is important to get breakfast included in your deal as the spread each morning, although good, was not worth the 26 euro per person that the hotel would charge to room only guests. The location of the Savoy is excellent, enjoying all the benefits of the Via Veneto without the extortionate price tag of it’s near neighbour The Excelsior. Having stayed in both properties I would definitely favour the Savoy, as both hotels are of equal distance to the nearby Spanish Steps, Villa Borghese etc but the excelsior amenities do not justify the extra price. . The nearest metro stop is Barberini and is less than 10 minutes’ walk away, linking you to, well not much really. The metro stops are not helpful for tourists looking to access the main sights of Rome, however there is a stop at the Collesseum, but other than that you would probably be better off on foot. The Savoy does not have a pool or gym, but the roof top bar area is an ideal spot for a drink at sunset. The rooms themselves are nothing special, we stayed in a plus room and although a little worn, it was perfectly comfortable and acceptable. One area in which the hotel fell down was on wi fi connection. 8 euro per hour or 18 Euro for 24 hours was a bit of a rip off considering many hotels offer it free, at least in communal areas. In conclusion the location of this hotel is excellent, the staff were always friendly and the rooms were comfortable and warm. The hotel could improve by offering leisure facilities on site and cutting wi fi charges drastically, however it would not put me off staying here again and if I was to get the right B&B rate I would happy to choose the Savoy again

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location, Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rubyfitz
Reviews.Content: This is not my first time to stay at the Savoy in Rome, but its my first review. Its situated on the Via Ludovisi off the Via Veneto. Ideal for walking to the Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain. There is also the 116 feeder bus which passes on the Veneto, its great for getting around the city and will take down as far as the Vatican. A small bus, but a neat way to get around. At the top of the Veneto, there is a underground walk way/access that will take you down to the Spanish steps or the Metro, quick & handy way to get around The hotel is maintained to a high standard, the breakfast buffet, has a great selection from breads to sweet pastries, to savory, eggs, bacon, fresh fruit etc, plenty of choice. Our rooms were spacious, clean and had the linens changed on a daily bases. The only 2 areas I would point out are, the internet access, expensive 35c a minute!!!! and wifi is not free I think €9 a day again a tad pricey Other then that the Savoy is a great hotel to stay in. I hope to return next year

Reviews.Title: “Our room was the size of a shoebox”
Reviews.Author: laylaDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Savoy Hotel on the weekend of the Ireland v Italy rugby match 4th and 5th February 2011. Our room 320 was by far the smallest room we have ever stayed in. The tv was in the wardrobe , if you needed to open the wardrobe door , it slid across in front of the tv. There was 20" between the end of the really hard beds and the wall!! The breakfast was ok. We would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location,service and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: wild-weird-witters
Reviews.Content: Could not fault from booking direct with the hotel , to arrival with welcome drinks,breakfast was everything you could want,drinks on the fabulous roof terrace - dinner in hotel. All excellent .Very friendly and welcoming staff especially Alexandra - also desk arranged a taxi back to the airport for a fee of 50 euros. When they realised it was a special birthday we returned to bubbly for two in the room!! Would highly recommend the hotel and the location could not be better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a small wedding reception with excellent food and service”
Reviews.Author: pugh7678
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding reception at the Hotel Savoy, which had the most amazing views over Rome. The meal itself was outstanding, and the wedding cake that was served - was to die for, and that’s mostly down to the credit of Aldo and his staff who effortlessly and flawlessly catered for all our guests needs. After our experience, we have no reservations in recommending this venue to anyone who wishes for an intimate wedding reception, with stunning views, beautiful surroundings, fantastic food, excellent wine, great music and staff who made sure that no one went without at all times and did so in a manner that no one sensed that they were there unless required. Brilliant management Aldo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Amenities in Rome”
Reviews.Author: detroiterchick
Reviews.Content: Rome and the Hotel Savoy was our last stop on a two week adventure through Switzerland and Germany. After staying in small, "no frills" hotels, The Hotel Savoy offered some of the luxurious comforts of home we had missed - namely a generous sized (by European standards) bathroom, large bed and a spacious (by European standards) room. The room was clean and maid service was dependable during our three-day stay. This reminded me of an American chain hotel with multiple floors and hundreds of rooms, a stark contrast to the boutique hotel experience during the rest of our trip. The Hotel Savoy's location was great with a Taxi stand located nearby for those who want to catch a cab and was a short (10 - 15 minute) walk to the Spanish Steps. The hotel's location is near a variety of large chain hotels (Intercontinental, Westin, etc.) and seemed to be a bit of a tourist haven, but it was not difficult at all to get off the beaten path for a more authentic experience, and still enjoy centrally-located lodging. The staff was consistently attentive, friendly and all spoke impeccable English. The staff provided very helpful guidance in what can be a very confusing city. The breakfast was nicely appointed and offered a variety of items. It was convenient, but if you are searching for a truly delicious Italian breakfast, I would skip the hotel breakfast and venture out into the city to enjoy local cuisine. The breakfast food wasn't particularly special, just convenient and not quite satisfying for the price. Internet was available in a small business center (3 computers) but we were too busy sightseeing to ever take advantage of it. The room was suprisingly quiet, and had windows that effectively drowned out the street noise. I can't there are any quiet hotels in Rome, but this one fit the bill. Overall, I would definitely recommend the Hotel Savoy for its great location and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, Friendly Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ksquare77
Reviews.Content: The room is small comparing to the usual one I stay in Italy, and the room they gave me was on the first floor, and with no view. However, you don't plan to stay in your room when you are in Rome right? This hotel is in a perfect location that you can walk to the Spanish Steps and major tourist attractions. The staff is super friendly, and every night I asked them for restaurant recommendations and they never disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Return Visit, Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: braunwynn
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time staying at the Hotel Savoy and, once again, our stay was amazing. I cannot compliment them enough for their "wonderful" front desk staff, their great, central location and the overall experience. To comment on the front desk staff--no task was too large or small for their assistance. From helping with reservations and directions to getting taxis for us when our pre-arranged airport transfer vendor didn't "show"....each task was handled with courtesy and friendliness. They truly made us feel as though we were members of their family who they were personally responsible for. My husband and I were with a group of people and each person felt the same about the hotel. The rooms were spotless, the breakfast was really good and the location....I'll repeat that the location was absolutely wonderful for Rome with the potential to walk to many major sites and great access to restaurants and the metro. I have recommended this hotel to other friends in the past and they, too, have really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: gimmishelter
Reviews.Content: We booked a four day package which included BA flights and three nights at the Savoy . Party of two adults and two teenagers ( 18 &19 ) My wife and i had stayed at another Hotel in the Via Veneto five years ago so knew this was a good location . The Hotel could not be faulted , clean well maintained with pleasent staff . The breakfasts were outstanding ! I would stay at this Hotel again without hesitation ..recommended . We would also recommend the car company ' ROME CABS for transferes to and from the airport . Very reliable , polite , honest , and above all very fairly priced in comparison to public transport for a number of people .

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, reasonably priced hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AlissaSam
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Savoy for my birthday, and was pleasantly suprised by the place from the outset. The entrance is quite grand, and the porter was ready as we stepped out of our taxi to help with our luggage. Was smoothly checked in at a busy reception and went off to our twin room which, really, was quite small, but very comfortable and we had a great view of the streets out the front. I expected it to get noisy in the evening but it was not. I think that the breakfast could have been a little better, my bacon was a little undercooked, however the pastries were nice. Okay I suppose, just not a great selection. I have to say that we could not have asked for a better location. The hotel was perfectly situated perfectly, within walking distance to some attractions. We walked to the shops, (Gucci, Bvlgari and Dior galore!) and visited the Trevi fountain, St Peter's & the Colusseum & The Vatican. Too much to see in just 4 days though... Wouldn't hesitate to return!

Reviews.Title: “Renovations Nice”
Reviews.Author: gunnerdog
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Savoy on October 25, 2010 for 3 nights. We enjoyed the remolded rooms. We had a very nice deluxe room which was spacious and a large granite bathroom. Was dissapointed that the bathroom towel bar warmer did not work. The beds are very hard, so if you prefer soft, this might be a problem. It bothered me the first night, but was ok after that. The staff allowed me to check out another room for the bed, but it was also hard. The free breakfast was just ok, nothing to rave about. Great views from the rooftop restaurant, but only checked it out, we did not eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Savoy was very lovely”
Reviews.Author: dbsaumsint
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Savoy at the end of Sept. Friends had told us not to expect much from the hotels in Italy, that there is no comparison to hotels in the US. We were very pleasanty surprised. The hotel lobby and our room were so pretty. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast was very nice - lots to chose from. Only problem was the shower curtain. It didn't prevent water from flooding the floor, even though it was inside the shower. I told the man at the desk and he said they were looking into getting new curtains. That was my only complaint about our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel~ Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: PattiCoo
Reviews.Content: Excellent location~ close to everything! Wonderful staff, beautiful rooftop resturant/bar. Love the soundproof windows/shutters. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “VERY COMFORTABEL FOR THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: kalifia
Reviews.Content: staff was helpful, price for Rome was VERY reasonable. good location safe, near shops, restaurants, room was on the small side compared to American standards, but comfortable, nice

Reviews.Title: “experience the grandeur of Rome and a comfortable price”
Reviews.Author: scottino84
Reviews.Content: This a large, elegant, older hotel - for me it was a quintessential Rome experience. The beautiful exterior and foyer were quite elegant and well maintained. The room was small but contained plush wall coverings and carpeting. The room was well kept and very clean. If you want to feel classic Rome without having to spend hundreds of Euros for one of the usual big hotels, this is the place for you. The location is also pretty good: far enough away from Termini to be in a nice are but still be walkable to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, Fabulous value”
Reviews.Author: ashmar14
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights after a cruise and absolutely loved the Hotel Savoy. Location, very close to the Spanish Steps, shopping, well priced restaurants. Staff was extremely helpful with Restaurant suggestions. Menu for the Buffet Breakast had everything you would want as you dined in a quaint breakfast room. Hop on Hop off bus station was just down the street for easy access. Loved everything about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant hotel in Classic Rome Style”
Reviews.Author: LoveroftheSunLondon
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a two night stay at the Savoy & i have to say that it exceeded our expectations. I had read reviews on TA stating that the decor was dated and that the staff were rude but I did not experiance this. We stayed in one of the suites which was stunning, huge rooms with a fresh fruit basket & a lovely big bathroom. We eat dinner on the roof top terrace & the food/wine was out of this world! The reception staff were very helpful & knew the aswer to every question! I would deffo recommend this hotel to my friends/family

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PB_Reviewer
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location. We could walk to the Spanish steps in about 15 mins. The amenities are basic, but it is clean and pleasant to stay at. Beware, they dont have irons due to health and safety reasons and the only english tv channels are the news channels. But that doesn't matter as you should be exploring the wonderful city. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly staff and first class location”
Reviews.Author: Danza711
Reviews.Content: I would stay at the Savoy Hotel on a return trip. The staff was extremely helpful booking attractions and restaurants. The breakfast is much more than the typical breads, fruit and strong coffee. The 5th avenue type shops of Via Veneto are just around the corner. Walking distance to the Spanish Steps, Villa Borghese Park and other popular sites. The roof top bar offers a fantastic view of Rome and especially St Peter's Dome.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ena01
Reviews.Content: We've got food poisoning from the breakfast, then spent some time in the hospital. My wife also got sick after we left the hospital. her condition was better than me, because she had a little piece from the sousage I had that the doctors believe was the reason. It was rotten. When we got back to the hotel and rested a little bit, I fell down because of my blood presure and called for help from the reception. The person came to our room said “I called the ambulance but if they don’t come, you will have to go on your own to the hospital”. I could not belive what I heard even in that condition; had a broken tooth, wounded nose and lips, beleeding so badly, some scracthes on my body and etc.., it realy helped me woke up and start thinking fast and logic, and I told him “ I can not walk, I can not get up”. He was more panic then us, which was not helping the situation at all. This is no way to behave in a situation like this, especially if you are some one in charge who should take some kind of resposibility. The ambulance came and and they did the first aid while I was lying on the bad. They decided to take me to a hospital. They put me on a stretcher and took me into the ambulance from the room, and this is the sadest part of the whole thing is; noone from Savoy Hotel was around, some housekeepers just looked at me and walked away while the ambulance man was trying to get me in to the elevator. The receptionist was dissappered, and noone was helping us. I can not understand how any of the Savoy staff could be insensitive, careless, disinterested to what was going on, and why there was no Savoy authority like hotel manager dealing with the situation. As soon as I was relased from the hospital, we decided to leave Rome and go back home, because I was not feeling well. When we were leving the hotel, the hotel staff just look at us and said “ARRIVEDERCI”. The porter carried our staff and did look at the 2€ tip my wife gave him with such discuss, like it was not good-enough for him. I am trying very hard not to think they there were happy we left. As a result of several unexpected incidents went back to each other, starting with a single sausage, caused us the trip, money, time and morality. I am writing this because eventhough the hotel has some nice things, in case you need help; YOU ARE ALONE. NO ONE WILL EVEN BOTHER TO COME AROUND YOU TO SEE WHAT'S GOING ON. This is not acceptable from the name SAVOY.

Reviews.Title: “good old hotel great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Edsalldw
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights two couples in two rooms. The hotel is in a great location near the spanish steps. It is a refurbished hotel so that it is clean and presents well but he rooms are original with added bathrooms. Thus they are very small and the walls a thin. The couple next door must have been on their honey moon because they had a lot of fun in the room several times over. Seriously at least 1 hour of continuous extasy for her. IT was entertainling the first time but got bothersome soon their after. The rooftop bar is great but the food is not up to par for Rome far better places around the corner toward the old Roman gate. The breakfast in the hotel is great. The best of our 17 day trip. The staff was nto very knowledgeable For instance the Hetrtz palce was a 10 minute walk but theshe did nto know how to tell me to get their Her directions were correct to the location except the Hertz was underground ( we could see it) in a large garage and the entrance to the garage was two blocks away with not easy way to get to where we end up up by her instructions. BUt a good palc eto stay for te money if you are there to see rome and do not plan to be in the hotel much.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in prestigious location”
Reviews.Author: LukeBris90
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the face it was very close to via veneto which is a beautiful street with plenty of restaurants and elegance with 5 star hotels. The hotel has a really nice lobby and the view of Rome from the rooftop restaurant was to die for although we didn't eat there because it was so expensive. The staff were very pleasent to us and handed us all sorts of brochures and maps of Rome. Our room was spacious and we had a nice view out on to the street. Even though it was not hot or even warm when we were in Rome, the air conditioning was not working which meant we had to sleep with our window open. That didn't bother us until early in the mornings we were woken to the garbage truck emptying the bins right outside out window. We ended up sleeping with the windows shut after that which kept the noise out. The only aesthetic down side to this hotel is the horrible grey carpet on the walls of the elevator which I had read in other reviews but it has to be seen to be believed, its so ugly and makes you feel like your in a 2 star hotel, not 4 stars! Breakfast was good with a large variety. I am happy we chose this hotel and if I return to Rome I probably would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “noisy with bad service”
Reviews.Author: Holly86London
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me here for a birthday treat in March. We were really excited about staying here as it was a good location and looked very promising on the website. Firstly, we were put in a twin room when we had specifically asked for a double. No problem, we thought, we'll ask nicely to be moved room. So the guy at front desk explained they were very sorry but they were fully booked that evening, however if we returned with our luggage the next morning we would be moved right away. (Bearing in mind we were only staying 3 nights) We agreed this would be ok. So the next day we did just that, only for him to accuse us of lying and that he did not tell us he would change our room! He said he had infact, told us they would push the two beds together and the maid would make the sheets into a double bed. If he had said that the night before we really wouldn't have kicked up any fuss, but anyone dare accuse us of lying and it's a different story! He obviously realised he couldn't move us so changed his story. To be honest, it was too short a trip to start complaining to management etc... i didn't want it to ruin our weekend, but it did make us very angry. I understand that's an isolated case, so here's what else is wrong with the hotel; VERY noisy- we were woken every night by the bin men in the street and other hotel guets. In fact one evening we could hear the lady in the next room's entire phone conversation! The walls are really thin. Breakfast was awful. We thought we got a good deal with it included, but we never went back after the first morning. We waited 10 minutes for a table, and the food consisted of mainly bagels, croissants and breads. Not much choice at all. The safe in our room was broken, so we had to leave our valuables in a safe at reception, a bit of an inconvenience when you want to have access to them frequently and you're room is on the 3rd floor! Beware of the bars and restaurants at the end of the road- they are extremely expensive and we paid 30 euros(!!!) for 2 vodka and lemonades on our first night! Everywhere is expensive but that was just a rip-off! I'd recommend Gusto or the Recafe to have dinner- a 10/15 minute walk from the Savoy. Overall, if you get a very good cheap rate for this hotel then it's fine as a place to get (a bit) of sleep. The location is great and it's also very clean. However, if i ever return to Rome i would not choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ianhatesidiots
Reviews.Content: Having read some reviews on this site, I became sceptical about staying at the Hotel Savoy, Rome. I can only wish that more expensive Hotels in the world would adopt their standards.

Reviews.Title: “Winter vacation”
Reviews.Author: badcats033
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Rome .I loved everything about this city .Beautiful architecture,museums,food .A little pricey.But all worth it. Savoy Hotel is beautiful .Rooms a little small.Hotel is really clean .Service is great. Loved the location and will visit again Great place for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Living The Life Of Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: xx_prada_princess_xx
Reviews.Content: The hotel was gorgeous, Staff were extremely friendly and location was good enough - it was VERY expensive, not just the hotel but Rome itself - an average meal was costing 30 euros for a main course!! We got the Hoppa bus the 1st day which picked up opposite our hotel and took us to all main points in Rome - would definately go again

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Scrumptious29
Reviews.Content: This was the last leg of our honeymoon and we spend 3 nights in Rome. Keep in mind...I'm not a 'high' class person, I grew up in Hamilton, Ontario, Canada...so just to give you an idea..it is a very 'working' class city. The hotel on the outside is very nice and the lobby as well. The rooms however are quite ugly and tacky. The elevator is weird, very narrow but quite long and it literally has grey carpeting all around it...you feel as though you might be in a mental ward and they needed to padd the walls. When we got to our room...I was immediately disappointed...it was very small...the bed was quite low to the floor and the bedding was really tacky..it was a putried yellow/grean colour with embroidered flowers in various shades of pink, yellow and blue...with leaves as well, and the curtains on the window matched! My husband and I looked at each other when the doorman closed the door and I was like...we need an upgrade. My husband called the lobby, very nicely asked for a free upgrade, and we got it. I think our new room was No. 503, it was better, bigger, and the design was more like a 1970s black and camel coloured combination. It was slightly better, so we decided to just roll with it, considering it was a free upgrade. The breakfast downstairs was very nice and lots of options and the dining area is nice as well. All in all, for the price that this hotel demands, I would not stay here again. This hotel is in a very ritzy area of Rome and I would prefer to stay at a hotel that is more in the bustle of the city. The location of this hotel is fine...with the subway station about a good 8-12 minute walk. If this hotel was cheaper I would stay here again...because you're never in your room in Rome, you're always out and about...but for the price, I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Reality behind the facade”
Reviews.Author: araf
Reviews.Content: Looks very impessive with a grand frontage and palm trees. but no active doorman. On a package deal for £522 for two for three nights inc flights from Gatwick so this price is reflected in my review. Given room 310 , small with old furniture, decent bathroom though but with tea towel like hand/face towels, bath towels not luxurious either. TV contained in wardrobe with safe in mini-bar! Room overlooked bins in side street, opposite building was being renovated with workmen on scaffolding so had to keep curtains closed, but there wasn't any view anyway. New double glazed windows and shutters were very efficient in keeping out noise and light but as the air conditioning had a mind of its own we needed the window open at night ,only to be interrupted at 07.45 by the bin lorry and at 01.30 on another night by a rich kid blatting his Ferrari down the side streets for a few circuits. Breakfast served in a gloomy basement manned by surly staff more interested in checking your name off on list rather than clearing tables or providing service. God forbid that anyone would get away with not paying for 2 Euros worth of food! Watery fruit juices and staff play a good game of trying to avoid serving you proper coffee from behind the counter and refer you to the machine in order for them not to do any work. Breakfast finishes at 10.00 but after bacon ran out at 09.25 they were reluctant to replenish. A rather miserable guy with a moustache grudgingly complied with some fatty new bacon at 09.50. Nice roof terrace with a view and a restaurant without a view! We were offered a discount offer of 15% off food but with set meals at 50 or 60 Euros per head we did better elsewhere. Very few public rooms at the hotel which has a mixture of diplomats, air crew, business and leisure travellers. Yet again the pictures in the brochure of the rooms bear no relation to the room you are actually given. A few general observation on Rome. The traffic! It is such a shame that every walk down a tiny side street with no pavement is interrupted several times by cars and motorbikes hell bent in getting to work or home a few mnutes earlier. It really is a joke and unless action is taken the whole city will become one big memorial to the car/motorbike and tourists will stay away. There really are no pedestrianised areas. Dont be afraid to use the metro/trams. We had a great afternoon by going to Frascati (to get away from the cars). Catch the train from Termini and for 1.90 Euros each you end up in a lovely hill town in half an hour. Buy a set picnic lunch for 5.90 each from the main square consisting of bread, pork, salami, cheese, proscuuiti and olives and with bottle of the Frascati for 6 Euros dine in a local park. Dont forget to validate ticket before getting on the train or risk a 100 Euro fine. Colliseum - audio guide for 4 Euros rubbish and a waste of money with confusing site numbers and with dry narrative. Roman Forum impressive but no signs or diagrams as they are trying to extract more money from you. Go to the Borghese Park near the hotel at the top of the Via Venoto and hire a bike for 4 Euros for an hour and enjoy the lovely gardens. Cafes in the park only open at the weekends in November. The prices - drinks out were very expensive. up to 14 Euros for a large beer and 12 Euros for two cappucinos! Spanish steps ruined at the moment with a faux Berlin wall to commemorate 20 years fall. Had a decent meal at Il Fiammifero Strano in road to the rear of the hotel. 40 Euros for two inc half litre of house wine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with superb service.”
Reviews.Author: MitsiDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Savoy Hotel for 5 nights at the end of October. The reception staff were very friendly,welcoming and helpful with advice as this was our first trip to Rome.Our room was on the 5th floor and was very spacious with plenty of room in the bathroom. The room was superbly cleaned and serviced each day. The breakfast was also excellent with a great variety of fruit, cereals, coldcuts and breads. The location was brilliant(Via Veneto) and within easy reach of all the major sights. All the hotel staff were very friendly to us during our stay and arranged taxis and cars to and from the airport for us. Liam, Dublin, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Prime location, great breakfast, delightful service”
Reviews.Author: cindros
Reviews.Content: Recommended by an Amex travel agent here in Boston. Location, location, location - right off the Via Veneto, 10 minutes to Spanish Steps - but on a quiet side street, so traffic noise was negligible (the occasional siren). Fabulous decor, decent-sized room, great bathroom with decent water pressure, in-room safe. Helpful, pleasant staff; TWO elevators, large-scale breakfast (eggs, cold cuts, cereals, tons of fruit, 4 juices, great espresso, yogurt, etc. - something for everyone!) and the absolute topper - fanTAStic roof terrace: multi-level, unbelievable views, friendly service, great selection of wines and liquors. That was where we ended our evenings - one last glass of wine on the comfy outdoor sofa by the fountain. not 'cheap' but so worth the $$$. would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: redheadNyc
Reviews.Content: friendly hotel staff, beautiful location near villa borghese in the heart of dolce vita but quiet location. large rooms, convenient shower and bathtub in good size bathroom and delicious breakfast. restaurant located on roofgarden, good food but a bit pricey specially for americans becaue of the weak $.

Reviews.Title: “Very shabby & deceiving, only 2-3 stars! Not recommended!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTraveller28
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel under any circumstances because it is over priced and definitely not a 5 or 4 star hotel. We paid £750 for three nights in a twin room. The breakfast was only average and there is virtually no service whatsoever so I don't know how this hotel claims 5 stars. A lot of the hotels in Rome have had their day and have not been decorated or renovated in decades, this is one of them. The rooms are really terrible, very very small with very old furniture and 14" televisions. The elevator is so old and doesn't work well. The facade of this hotel with palm trees and grand entrance is a great deception, the lobby looks great but then once you get into the lift and up to the rooms you feel absolutely cheated. There is no restaurant or bar in the hotel either so it feels deserted at nighttime, there's no atmosphere. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from Spanish Steps. Stay elsewhere while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great location.”
Reviews.Author: chillimini
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights recently,booking two single rooms.It is in a great location,just off Via Veneto,with lots of good restaurants nearby.The rooms were very comfortable and clean,and had good air conditioning.The staff were friendly and helpful.We tried the rooftop bar one night for a drink,a bit expensive but nice views over Rome.The RomaTour open top bus stops right outside and is well worth trying,giving a good overview of the main sights.I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: PIKATSOU
Reviews.Content: The position of the hotel is ideal.Very close to Spanga Steps,Via Veneto,Fontana de Trevi etc.Walking distance from metro,taxi,bus stop and touristic bus.The hotel was very cozy,clean and quiet.Very good breakfast(perfect for Rome).Tip:ask for a capucino do not take from the machine.If you can afford take a car to the airport (cost 50 EUR, takes 45 min) We did not , and regrate.Almost missed plane.Metro and train is below average in Rome. Stuff very polite.Generally very good hotel in perfect position(maybe a little expensive,but worth it)We will go again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarolJeanne
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at how large the room was. It actually had a seperate sitting room from the bedroom. The room was clean and the hotel was well managed. The staff were courteous and quite helpful. The restaurant was very flexible in their menu (ie: my son wanted something that was not on the menu however they were able to produce what he asked for). On one occasion our room was not made up and we called the front desk to let them know and within 5 minutes someone came to our room to rectify the problem. It is very convenient to literally hundreds of restaurants and stores (walking distance). It was also close to the subway as well. I truly enjoyed our stay and so did my family. The only thing that I would suggest to the hotel is to offer free internet access. Most hotels do offer this and I was surpised that they did not. However this complaint is minimal and I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean rooms, pleasant staff = great stays”
Reviews.Author: oneluckyperson
Reviews.Content: After our very bad experience at Atlante Gardens hotel (near the Vatican), this place was like a 5 star hotel to us. It was so refreshing to walk into the lobby and be greeted by a very pleasant staff. The lady who helped us was very knowledgeable. She talked and interacted with us in a professional manner. We also saw an airline crew at the hotel--a sign that it's a probably good value type of hotel. Our room was clean and simple. I just wished that they wouldn't use the black furry blankets because it was sort of uncozy. I understand it's a style thing, but they should really follow the new trend of using duvet sheets that can be washed daily. The bathroom was spacious and clean too. Breakfast was yummy and had plenty of choices. The location is great! You can walk to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and all the Piazzas with ease. There are plenty of places you can check out without the need of a cab. This hotel is right in the thick of things. There is always something to do outside and there are always people walking around. You won't be bored. If you do need a cab, there's a cab station across the street.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel which does not justify 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: PeterM01
Reviews.Content: The Savoy write up on the web site is misleading. It is not in my experience rate 4 stars. The ground floor reception and puplic rooms are small with the lounge area very tired looking. Our room over looked a vacant space in the centre of the hotel, which meant we kept the curtains closed. No Tea / Coffee making falcilities. The air conditioning was turned off after 11.00pm until 9.00am next morning. It made for a hot night. The room furniture was very tired. Service was average and you felt as you were just another tourist, when will hotels understand that good friendly service makes such a difference. On the positive side the location was good and we walked to all the main sites from the hotel and with the park nearby as well. We would not recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rome...”
Reviews.Author: mattokerlund
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing fancy, but I have a feeling it is still almost as good as it gets in Rome. The room was hot because the AC was not on yet for the summer, but it was clean in a great location. We walked everywhere! The breakfast in the mornings was nice!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and smelly bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: Winnie_119
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with three other friends for three nights. When I checked out after the first night (to take a two-day side-trip), I asked the staff to keep our suitcases in the hotel and was refused. The staff claimed that it was hotel policy and said I could send my suitcases to some storage companies for six euros each per day. As we couldn't possibly tug the suitcases for the side-trip, we asked the staff to cancel our subsequent reservation for two nights. The staff, apparently worried about losing our business, talked to the manager on the phone and finally agreed to keep our suitcases on an exceptional basis at no charge. The whole exchange was very unpleasant and the so-called policy was quite absurd. A few days earlier, we did the exact same thing in another hotel in Florence (Hotel Continentale which by the way is excellent in terms of the rooms, service and location) and there was no hesitation at all from that hotel in acceding to our request. The concierge service of this hotel is also less than satisfactory. We asked them to help us book tickets for the Colleseo and again they refused to do it. Instead the hotel asked us to book local tours (which would charge us much more). I fail to see any valid reason for their refusal to do something which would have incurred no cost to them. Lastly, I do not know if it is just this hotel or all 'old' hotels in general. The bathroom (of all the rooms we stayed at) are quite smelly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & staff”
Reviews.Author: Clivethegreat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the corner of Via Vento and Via Ludovisi adjacent to the American Embassy and literally a couple of minutes walk from the Barberinin Metro (underground).
