The hotel staff were excellent (ignore any grumbling people on here) There is a lovely lady who was on reception (I cannot rememebr her name, but she is dark skinned and called something like Gerda or Gedra oe Gega (sorry I forgot your name, but she is extrememly helpful and informative (thanks you for all your help and assistance), The staff were so good to notice that it was my partners birthday while we were there (we never mentioned anything to them) and they surprised us with a lovely bottle of well presented champaign while we were out - it was so nice to come ot the room and find it laid out (thank you). I can hardly fault the hotel, excep tot say the lack of airconditioning meant that it sometimes got noisey at night - if you left the windows open. Breakfast was included and there was the regular contiental and english breakfasts. Hotel is within easy walking distance of the Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain (10 minutes) and also close to Harrys Bar. Had one of the best ice-creams ever, just up the road at the ritz cafe (3 euros, but lots of icecream - very good value for money in comparison to other areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dafbird
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in the Savoy. It's in a great location. The room was clean & spacious & quiet too. The beds were big. The breakfast was great in the morning, lots of choice. One of the nicer European hotels we've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel - super location!”
Reviews.Author: Wynne16
Reviews.Content: I would recommend The Savoy hotel if you are visiting Rome. It is an excellent location just off Via Veneto and about a 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps. The Rome City Tour buses stop just outside the hotel, which is so handy if you intend doing a bus tour when you are there. The bedrooms are spacious, clean and comfortable, bathroom is very nice and the shower was great! Breakfast is very good, great variety. Hotel staff were very helpful and pleasant. We just had one drink up on the terrace bar ( €7 for glass of wine). There are lots of cafes/bars and great places to eat near by. We got a very good deal for b and b as we were staying there in March. Overall, a perfect hotel for a city break in the beautiful city of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed I've ever slept in, Great Location too”
Reviews.Author: shnugen7
Reviews.Content: I'm confused as to why this hotel is getting such hit-or-miss ratings because i thought that this was one of the finest hotels that I've been in. Although my interaction with the staff was limited considering I have a great deal of knowledge about the area, I must say that the hotel exceeded expectations. Firstly, the bed...oh my god the bed was amazing. It was so hard to get up in the morning because of how soft everything was. On multiple occasions I got up later than anticipated because I just could not get myself up from that bed. Secondly, the location was fantastic. A 15 minute walk takes you to everything in the heart of Rome...the Colosseum, the Ruins, etc. The breakfast was also a nice touch. Although they charged a great deal for internet, there's an internet cafe 5 minutes away that was super cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelswithkids02
Reviews.Content: I can not believe some of these reviews. This hotel is beautiful, the service was outstanding and the front desk staff did everything possible to help us. My husband and I went with our 2 boys and the staff could not have been more helpful. They even helped us book soccer tickets. Truly a beautiful hotel, well located. I don't understand what people are complaining about !!!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: gallacherscotland
Reviews.Content: My wife booked this hotel for a birthday treat for me, I read the other reviews and I wondered what I was in for! I only book 4star plus hotels and I have travelled extensively around the world visiting many capital cities and i would return to this hotel , the hotel is in a very good location, walk 8 minutes to Spanish steps , at the bottom of the steps are ALL the maor designer shops, walk to good eateries, if you don't like walking 10 euros will get you to most locations in one of the many white taxis. Terrace bar does a very good club sandwich, did'nt eat at night, room was very clean and fresh, bed was firm the way a decent bed should be. Staff were very friendly and helpful, don't go to the terrace bar for a drinking session unless you have a very thick wallet. Don't let some of the American reviews put you off this hotel is better than lots of the so called top hotels in Manhatten. Don't order wine in cafe de paris round the corner , cheapest bottle starts at 60 euros (same bottle 18 euros in Savoy) and staff are ignorant. Do go to Piaza Narvone , eat in Berninis fab atmosphere, great food ,great people watching , street entertainers etc.

Reviews.Title: ““Don't Stay Here! Beds Are Horrible!””
Reviews.Author: cbough1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights while on our honeymoon.We booked our trip through a "go-today travel site".DON'T stay here if you want to sleep. The bed mattresses are old, thin, and VERY hard. We asked the concierge if we could stay in a different room, and he said that all the beds were the same.So we had to ask for 3 additional thick blankets to fold over and "pad" the bed with. We checked into changing our hotel, but because we were on a tight schedule, we had to "tough it out".We have stayed at a lot of hotels in europe, and U.S.But this one by far had the worst beds, especially for the price that we paid.We recommend staying at Hotel Eden instead. It is located about 1 block the west of the Savoy. It is a more elegant hotel, AND it was cheeper by about 100 Euro at the time we inquired.Hotel Eden did not include breakfast, but there is a cafe nearby (1 min. away) for that.Cafe Lemo: The best Cappuccino!!! Better than Starbucks! 1.50 Euro! Best Price in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “aboslutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: wuvsy
Reviews.Content: me and my boyfriend stayed at the savoy hotel inrome in June for my 18th birthday and we both had the most fantastic time. the hotel staff looked after you the moment you wlked in and caried your cases to your room and made sure everything was ok before leaving you to your own devices. breakfast was really good and we had our last evening meal there in the roof top terrace and it was gorgeous - the best meal i have had for ages - no word of a lie. the rooms were kept immaculate and the beds were really comfy - NO BED BUGS AT ALL - the rooms were a decent size - not too big not too small and the air conditioning was heaven. the hotel was very handy for seeing all the sights and getting to the metroand checking out the restaurants and bars . could not fault one thing with this hotel and would recommend it one hundred percent to anybody stopping in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not that Great”
Reviews.Author: PebHouston
Reviews.Content: Let me start my saying that I should have taken the advice from the May 23, 2008 posting. If you are American and like a good bed, this is not your hotel. The Hotel Savoy was beautiful on the outside; but the room was very old (ex. TV from the 70's.. couldn't read the numbers on the remote and no alarm clocks and old carpets,including the thin linens and the bed itself was just bad and the Front Desk staff was not very friendly). We changed rooms 3 times to get a decent room. We should have just paid the extra to stay at another hotel. However, the Hotel location was good, as we went to a few cafes around the area. I will probably select a location alittle more central. FYI:The Vatican was amazing..can't wait to see it again. Note to Self: Need umbrella and bottled water when visiting St. Peter's Square because of Sun.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely area.”
Reviews.Author: LindiManchester
Reviews.Content: A little too far from the Spanish Steps and T. Fountain .These attractions were quite a long walk downhill from the hotel. Would like to see a little more choice in cooked breakfast but the choice in pastries ect.. was good. Staff polite and helpful and were very willing to book trips. The tour bus stops opposite the hotel, which is a nice way to see Rome. Only wish that I had booked half board before my stay as Rome is very expensive. Would have liked to have bathrobes provided but the beds and cleanliness of the room v. good. Nice roof terrace.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in a city that never sleeps”
Reviews.Author: Wendywhy1
Reviews.Content: We had a double room with an extra bed on the first floor. Extra bed was for an 8 year old but would be ok for an adult. Room was plenty big enough, more than enough room to walk around. Room was very quiet. We had no problems at all. Bathroom was fine. Shower over bath. Well stocked with soap etc. Breakfast was excellent. We were very late down every day but there was always plenty food. Hotel is about 5-10 mins walk from top of Spanish Steps so you can get around quite easily. Not much traffic aound hotel, so not much noise. We were there over the rugby international weekend, so it was quite nice to get away from the noise, and hustle and bustle. We will stay at this hotel next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: moressi
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here. The place is clean, the staff professional, the brekfast buffet very good and the location convenient. What I expected for the price was a little better decor as the entire hotel, with the exeption of the rooftop restaurant, is quite old and worn-out. This also goes for the room and bathroom: clean, but they definitely need a refurbisment. Plus there were no bathrobe and no slippers: not a big issue, really, but you could expect a little more from a 4 star. So not bad after all, but don't expect too much!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, minor annoyances.”
Reviews.Author: ATLyuppie
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the hotel and had a great stay. The hotel was clean and well kept. They also honored our special room location requests. Very helpful staff and the room was cleaned nicely everyday. Some of the bad things were that the beds were very hard and my wife and I could feel some of the coils in the bed. The bathtub shower was extremely narrow such that i could not stand directly facing the showerhead at times. Due to insurance regulations there was no iron available in the entire hotel. Also the hotel was in the area north of the Spanish Steps, while this is great when you are heading down to the main sights in the heart of the city; its the hike back up on the return trip that gets old really fast. Overall, it was a great hotel in a great location with some minor annoyances.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Deb3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just off the Via Veneto. We took the Terravison bus from Ciampino airport to Termini Railway Station. This costs 8 euros or 14 return. We walked from Termini to the hotel but a taxi only costs 7 euros. Our room was spacious and clean - no bed bugs! The decor was tired and dated. The bathroom too was clean but it certainly needed replacing. Only very basic toiletries were provided - soap & shampoo only. We were disappointed that the roof top bar/terrace was closed for refurbishment. The staff said that we could go outside to take photos but we couldn't sit out in the sunshine. The staff we spoke to were helpful. We asked the reception satff to recommend a restaurant for us which they did and reserved a table for us. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the Spanish Steps, Trevi fountain, Piazza Barberini, Villa Borhese. The blue "Ciao Roma" open top tour bus stops right outside the hotel. This costs 19 euros for the day and is well worth it.There is also a taxi rank outside the hotel too. The continental breakfast was fine - plenty of fresh fruit, rolls etc. The cooked breakfast was disappointing - the choice was boiled eggs, hot dog sausages, soggy scrambled eggs, greasy,fatty bacon. I travelled to Rome last year & stayed at the Gladiatori Hotel which is right by the Colloseum. I preferred that hotel to the Savoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Phaedra08
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a good choice as far as location is concerned. It is near Villa Borghese just around Via Veneto - very nice area. The room was very clean and so was the bathroom. Unfortunately like most Roman hotels it looks old and out-of-time. The lobby area was poor, and the reception was also less than helpful when it came to information about restaurants or sites or shopping times. Polite but not very helpful. The absolute plus was the excellent breakfast with fresh fruit, different kinds of bread, pastries, great coffee, cereal, cheese/ham, yoghurts, eggs, bacon and so on! Good choice but dont expect much luxury

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: joe54
Reviews.Content: Good location! Some of the rooms are small.The hotel has had some problems with bed bugs I had to find out the hard way.Make sure to look under the mattress.I told the staff about them thay did't seem to care.So be safe and never put your luggage on the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: mur54
Reviews.Content: Very comfoirtable stay, Superior Double room recommended, good buffet breakfast, Friendly staff and great location will definetly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Location”
Reviews.Author: DAMELISA
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to the savoy hotel for my 40th birthday in January and we had an excellent time. The hotel is very clean, the room and the reception are decorated realy nice. All the membersof staff were excellent and very helpful. The concierge reception were great although I had read previous reviews that they had been unhelpful, we definately did not exppierence this, In fact they could not have helped us more from explaining bus routes, booking tours and restaurant reservations for us. On my 40th birthday I even received a complimentary bottle of champagne from the manager, which I thought was lovely and great service. The tour bus which takes you right round the city stops right outside the hotel. The spanish steps and the designer shops like gucci, prada and dior etc, are only literaly a 10 minute walk away. There are lots of lovely restaurants like cafe de Paris, hard rock cafe and the world famous harry's bar are literally just round the corner from the hotel. The hotel restaurant and bar are really nice and again give excellent service. The food is rather expensive but very nice. Although it was january we sat outside on the rooftop terrace most nights, as they will put the heaters on for you, It was fab! looking across rome it was fantastic. The only one thing I have to mention as a bad point is that the mattress was way too hard for me and I ended up having a bad night sleep for the four nights that we were there. That is a personal point though, as my husband was not bothered by the hard mattress at all. Overall we had an excellent stay at this hotel and would definately recommend it. Thank you so much Savoy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: chgreen
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel. I liked this hotel alot. The breakfast was really good. Room was very nice and a good size. Bath was also large and nice. Service in hotel was good. The only negative to hotel was the mattress. You could feel the springs in mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: ElvisPresley77
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my husbands 40th birthday and it did not disappoint. Our room, although not huge was very comfortable if a little warm but we managed to just turn the heating off! It was a little noisy if you opened the windows but to be honest the road it is on is no where near as noisy as the main road adjacent so felt we could not complain. Rome is a noisy city afterall. The location was superb, so near everything and close to the metro. We used the metro to get to the Vatican, only 1 euro per person one way. Bargain! I had opted for half board so we ate at the hotel every evening and the food was lovely. The waiters could not do enough for us. My husband was given champagne in his room on his birthday which was a lovely surprise and gratefully received. Breakfast as really nice and plenty of choice. All in all, really pleased with the Savoy. Only problem we did have was room was not ready on our arrival (we were early though). Front desk staff could be friendlier - my only gripe - can't be bad!!!

Reviews.Title: “Savoy Rome”
Reviews.Author: JohnoWirral
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Savoy for 4 nights at Xmas 07. The hotel is simple but very well equipped by Italian Standards. Buffet breakfast is simple but more than adaquate, beside you dont go to Italy to enjoy the breakfast so ignore the negative reviews on this aspect. Location is excellent, only 5 minutes walk to the metro which is perfect for getting to the Vatican / coleseum, good tip is to buy a 1 Euro train ticket and get the train one way and then walk back and take in the pantheon, trevi fountain and spanish steps on the way back to the hotel. Good restraunts in the local area and if you get bored of Pasta there is the Hard rock cafe just around the corner. In summary, this is a good hotel by Italian standards and is in an excellent location. Other tip is to buy a bus ticket at the airport (8 Euro per person) and take a coach direct to Rome Termini and then get a taxi to the hotel (7 Euro). This will save you 30 Euro if two of you are travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent value”
Reviews.Author: newhorizonsny
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Savoy for 4 nights in the middle of November. Our overall experience was positive, but this hotel seems to cater more exclusively to business travelers than tourists. The staff is not overly accommodating but overall they were helpful enough. The room itself was a good size by European standards but this hotel needs some up keeping. The furniture is extremely old and run down looking and the decor is very dated. Also, if you are a light sleeper I would recommend some earplugs - this hotel is on a narrow street and there are windows facing the street on most sides. In terms of value, it depends on the rates - my american express travel agent was able to secure a rate $100 US dollars less per night than what all of the major travel websites were advertising. The location of this hotel is excellent. It is around the corner from Via Veneto - it is within walking distance of some attractions (the Spanish steps, Trevi fountain) and it is very close to other forms of transportation. The metro stop is only a few blocks, there is a taxi stand on the corner and one of the hop on hop off tourist buses (ciao roma) actually stops right across the street from the hotel (this was not a bad way to first acclimate yourself with the city). The complimentary buffet breakfast was good, they actually had a nice variety of food but I would definitely recommend getting there on the early side. The one morning we went down closer to 9AM it looked like it was picked clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: availablename
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great -- a short (less than 10 min) walk away from the Spanish Steps, and the rooms are clean, with comfortable beds. The breakfast buffet was standard, with one major flaw: sketchy scrambled eggs. If you want eggs, stick with the hard-boiled ones. Also, the location of the hotel puts it near busy streets, and well, Italians do love to honk their horns. So you'll want to bring ear plugs. If you want to work out, you'll have to go to a nearby gym. While the hotel's site ([--]) indicates that it has a fitness center, that is not the case. They'll give you a voucher to go elsewhere. Also, they charge an arm and a leg to use the computers in the lobby. Over all, not a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: USGilly
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel! Its location was paramount.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Mel92207
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a beautiful part of the city, a short walk to the Spanish Steps and Villa Borghese. My new husband and I were able to walk to almost every single attraction we wanted to see. The Colessum is a long walk from here. The staff was not as openly friendly as I thought they would be, but they weren't rude. The room was clean and quiet. The bathroom was large and very up to date. We were situated in a room where there was a dumb waiter on the other side of the wall which could be heard throughout the night. A little annoying considering what we paid for the room. We also come to find out that Delta airlines uses this hotel to put up the flight crews, so every morning the lobby was PACKED with flight attendants checking in and out. The breakfast was included with the room. It was tasty and they had a decent amount of variety. I don't know if I would stay here again, but the only reason I would go elsewhere would be to have a more central location in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views.....”
Reviews.Author: Stream62
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel as part of my honeymoon in July. We had a wonderful time in Rome as part of this. We had been to Rome before but stayed in a villa in a different part of the city. This hotel is just off of the Via Veneto, full of nice hotels and restaurants, and easy walking distance to the Spanish Steps (although the walk up every day can be slightly wearing). The placing of it is great for a walking tour and the main sights are not too far away, one of the bus tours also stops very close to the hotel if you prefer not walking. As an aside here the hotel is very close to the Villa Borghese a brilliant green space full of museums and art galleries which I only discovered this trip. The hotel was very nice, clean and well presented. The rooms were of average size for a 4 star. Breakfast was good with a mixture of continental and cooked choices served in the cellar area. The hotel restaurant/bar is a must do in this hotel and we were dissapointed that we only discoved it on the second to last night. I sits ontop of the hotel and was always quiet. Service was excellent with the staff very professoinal but also friendly, they also seemed very glad to see us. When we dined there we were one of only 4-5 tables occupied. The food was ex cellent and some of the best we had in Rome. The views from the bar are amazing and you can see many of the sights of Rome from up there. We spent a hugely romantic and restful last night up there drinking a bottle of champagne (this was suprising cheap, by the way) and watching the sun go down over Rome. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone and especially the rooftop bar/restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “No question - we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: NorthallGreenTurtle
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a double-room (for my wife and me) and a single for our 22 year-old daughter (her first holiday with us for 5 years). We walked to the hotel from the central station (about 25 mins), and returned by taxi (10 mins). [There's a train that runs between central station and the airport every 30 mins - it costs 11€ each way. Be warned though, luggage has to be lifted about 4 feet from the ground up onto the train.] The hotel is in a relatively quiet street and one of the city's hop-on/hop-off open-top buses stops right outside. I love an open-top tour; it's the quickest way to see a city and decide where to focus the rest of the break. Our room over-looked the street but there was very little traffic noise. The nearest underground/subway station is a 10 min walk away. We'd never used the Rome system before but it's easy - on some of the automatic ticket machines you can even select which language you want the instructions to be displayed in - and for 1€ a trip it's possible to get anywhere quickly and cheaply. Having said that, we walked a lot and had a great time admiring the contrast between great architecture and, well, not-so-great buildings. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. As part of the standard process we were given a map of the city, a brochure offering some tours, and a voucher for a discount in the roof-top restaurant. The double-room was a “superior” room. There was a complimentary basket of fruit in the room, and the mini-bar was free! They told me this when we checked in, but when I saw premium brand wines, spirits, and soft drinks in the fridge I phoned reception to double-check! What's more, the mini-bar was automatically re-stocked each day The room also had a safe that was big enough for my laptop (a small one without a CD/DVD drive) AND my digital SLR AND my camcorder. Tight fit, but they all fitted. The en-suite included a bath (with a fixed shower) and was well stocked with toiletries - including toothbrushes and razors in case we'd forgotten ours. There was also a hair dryer. The single room was a “plus” room and was also a decent size. This overlooked the courtyard – nothing special, but the room was booked for its size, not for a view. Breakfast buffet was included. Hot food (sausage, scrambled eggs, and bacon), cold meats/cheese, fruit, cereal, etc were good. We had a problem at the roof-top restaurant. They delivered the wrong starter. I waited for mine while my wife and daughter ate theirs. When it arrived (with apologies) the food was fine. On other evenings we choose to eat in the nearby restaurants on the pavement / sidewalk (enclosed in glass 'conservatories') where the food was better. Particularly enjoyed the food and atmosphere at the Cafe de Paris - the pianist was excellent, his repertoire included Italian music, Stevie Wonder, and Ray Charles! Overall, we were very happy at this hotel and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: slp82
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Savoy in Feb 07 and it was the perfect place to explore Rome from. The entrance of the hotel is beautiful with helpful and effiicient staff working 24 hrs. The room was clean with a mini bar and lovely bathroom. There is a city tour bus stop directly outside the hotel so we were able to return to the hotel doors after a full day in Rome. I would definitely stay here again as it is near the Trevi Fountain and just around the corner from the Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Great location shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: RobynDublin
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was in a great location, it was clean and the breakfast was nice. However I thought the food was overpriced in the hotel. Some of the staff were nice but some were quiet rude and unpleasant. One guy bit my head off cause I had a query about something. Im sorry I didnt report him. There are loads of other centrally located hotels so Id recommend booking somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Suziemack
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. I had read reviews on 20 other hotels and finally decided on the Savoy. The room was large enough to accommodate two adults and a 5 and 7 year old. The bathroom was new and modern and on the recommendation of a few of the reviews I had read on this hotel, we stayed in a room facing the courtyard. The rooftop bar area is beautiful with a wonderful view of the city. The staff were very kind and friendly and the breakfast is fantastic....a full buffet breakfast is offered. I can't wait to go back to Rome and I will definitely be staying at the Savoy on our next trip. It is close enough to all the sights...We walked everywhere with our kids....and once you work out the shortcut to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain - you are on your way!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: majentalondon
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 5 four daughters and 73 year old mother. We had a treble room and a double. The treble room was a very decent size, no view but nice and comfortable. The double had a view and was very nice too. The staff were very helpful on the front desk ordering us 5 seater taxis when we asked. the location of the hotel is fab 10 mins walk from spanish steps and trevi fountain. Breakfast was a bit chaotic but i think it was as we chose the busiest time to go down ((9 a.m). A nice choice of cold and cooked plus fruits and juices cereals etc. I have stayed at this hotel about 6 years ago it has been renovated since then and is very nice the rooftop bar is very nice was a bit too cold for us to sit out in march we sat inside. would def reccomend this hotel for the price good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: E_of_Virginia
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in Rome. The Hotel Savoy was a very pleasant surprise. For Europe, the room was very large and clean. The staff was helpful and friendly. However, the resturant for dinner was over priced and uninspired.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TerryGranade
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Around the corner from the AMERICAN EMBASSY at 15 Via Ludovisi. It's about 5 blocks above the Spanish steps and the same from Barbarini-Fontana Metro station. English is spoken by most of the staff. The rooms are nice and quiet. Request an even numbered room. They on the courtyard, not on the street. The blackout panels work well. With no A/C in room, in the winter the rooms can get warm after a 75 degree day. The bathrooms have showers and are nice. We ordered in extra pillows. You know those flat things european hotels have. The hotel has a buffett breakfast in the basement in the mornings.They even made iced tea for me since I don't drink coffee. There is a roof hotel bar up on the sixth floor. There are some great views at night. I will definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarieCork
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. Location very central. Staff very helpful. Great breakfast to set you up for the day. Lobby beautiful, welcoming. Room small but with everything you need for a short stay, lovely bathroom. would strongly recommend!!! Advice: book it yourself. Through the travel agent it was double the price as i was accidently given the travel agent receipt.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Poor Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: DixieVicky
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good location but had little else to say for itself. The rooms were adequate but there was no room service, no real restaurant to speak of and the front desk staff left a lot to be desired. When we wanted anything, we went across the street to the Westin Excelsior for help; whether we needed dinner reservations, directions, taxi... anything, we found our hotel to be inept and the Westin staff was excellent. That would be our choice next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: rolfitaly
Reviews.Content: The hotel was OK, although relatively expensive for a small room. You pay for the location on the luxurious Via Veneto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: lok
Reviews.Content: Stayed In March 2005 nice hotel, room a bit on small side but staff friendly, would go there again, great location for walking to most sites and food was good.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Savoy
HotelInfo.Address: Via Ludovisi 15, 00187 Rome, Italy
